newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: BNZ cuts fixed housing, business and farm rates.
newsitem.headline: BNZ cuts fixed housing, business and farm rates.

text.p: Bank of New Zealand Ltd said on Tuesday it was cutting its fixed lending rates for housing, business and farm loans.
The bank cut its one-year fixed home loan rate to 10.25 percent from 10.5 percent, the two-year rate to 9.75 from 9.90 and the three-year rate to 9.25 percent from 9.90 percent.

The one-year business and farm fixed lending rate was cut to 10.25 percent from 10.75, the two-year to 9.95 from 10.25 percent and the three, four and five-year rates to 9.75 percent from 10.25 percent.
The bank said this followed the fall in long-term wholesale interest rates after last week's general election and lower-than-expected September quarter inflation figures.
